title.narrative: OT3.1. SPECIAL EDUCATION NEEDS

description.narrative: By 2020, children with special educational needs have improved access to quality inclusive education at pre-school and school level., which contributes to Children With Disabilities, Children With Disabilities (Covid), Data And Child Protection, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, children with disabilities progressively realize their rights to education, rehabilitation and social protection and to participate in community life.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, children with special educational needs have improved access to quality inclusive education at pre-school and school level.

description.narrative: UNICEF in Armenia advocated for and supported the education system reforms aimed at inclusion of children with special needs in general education institutions, as well as promoted and supported the development of inter-sectoral procedures and capacity of teachers, social workers, school nurses and school managers to ensure inclusion of children with special needs, including CWD in the education process. | Status:Met | As-of Date:21/01/2022
